trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure account by entering your credentials.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure account by entering your credentials.

trans-unit.source: This method is quicker and easier, but if you use this method you won't be able to see Azure SQL Database or Mobile Services in the **Server Explorer** window.
trans-unit.target: This method is quicker and easier, but if you use this method you won't be able to see Azure SQL Database or Mobile Services in the **Server Explorer** window.

trans-unit.source: In **Server Explorer**, click the **Connect to Azure** button.
trans-unit.target: In **Server Explorer**, click the **Connect to Azure** button.

trans-unit.source: An alternative is to right-click the **Azure** node, and then click **Connect to Azure** in the context menu.
trans-unit.target: An alternative is to right-click the **Azure** node, and then click **Connect to Azure** in the context menu.

trans-unit.source: Install a management certificate that enables access to your account.
trans-unit.target: Install a management certificate that enables access to your account.

trans-unit.source: In **Server Explorer**, right-click the **Azure** node, and then click **Manage Subscriptions** in the context menu.
trans-unit.target: In **Server Explorer**, right-click the **Azure** node, and then click **Manage Subscriptions** in the context menu.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Azure Subscriptions** dialog box, click the **Certificates** tab, and then click **Import**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Azure Subscriptions** dialog box, click the **Certificates** tab, and then click **Import**.

trans-unit.source: Follow the directions to download and then import a subscription file (also called a *.publishsettings* file) for your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Follow the directions to download and then import a subscription file (also called a *.publishsettings* file) for your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Download the subscription file to a folder outside your source code directories (for example, in the Downloads folder), and then delete it once the import has completed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Download the subscription file to a folder outside your source code directories (for example, in the Downloads folder), and then delete it once the import has completed.

trans-unit.source: A malicious user who gains access to the subscription file can edit, create, and delete your Azure services.
trans-unit.target: A malicious user who gains access to the subscription file can edit, create, and delete your Azure services.
